title: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Kemp's office on June 8, 2023, the Governor's office awarded more than $83.5 million in grants for 118 qualified projects as part of the Community Public Safety Grant program. This included grants of $1,301,289 and $347,542.80 for two different projects described in additional documents provided by the Governor: https://gov.georgia.gov/sites/gov.georgia.gov/files/2023-06/Grantee%20List%20for%20Public%20Safety%20Release1024_2.jpg

Press Release: https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-06-08/gov-kemp-announces-835m-community-public-safety-grant-awards#:~:text=In%20accordance%20with%20grant%20requirements,violence%20resulting%20from%20the%20pandemic.

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents from the "Community Public Safety Grant" program for the two grants of $1,301,289 and $347,542.80 received by the Brookhaven Police Department, as described in the Governor's press release and additional documents. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

title: Use of Force Policy (Horn Lake Police Department)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy (Horn Lake Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blake Feldman

Good Afternoon, 

For all FOIA request and copies of Police Report request there is a $10 fee for the first page and $2 fee for additional pages. Our USE OF FORCE POLICY consist of 6 pages bringing the total fee for your request to $20. A check in that amount can be mailed to and made out to the Horn Lake Police Department, 3101 Goodman Rd W, Horn Lake, MS 38637 or we also accept exact cash. Since our receptionist will be the one who receives the payment please include a remark, or separate note indicating this payment is for our USE OF FORCE POLICY per Lt. Grayson. I have already spoken to her about it and she will then send me an email that the payment has been received. Once payment is received I can either mail the documents or send them electronically. Thank you.

Thank you.

title: Agency Scope per F.S. 114.0455

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Scope per F.S. 114.0455
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida's Sunshine Laws:

I request all records within the jurisdiction of the Florida Department of Financial Services within the time frame of 2017 to 2023, to be the day on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria:

1. Records/documents that describe and detail the policies and procedures surrounding reasonable suspicion subject an employee to drug testing per Florida's Drug-Free Workplace Act (F.S.112.0455).

2. Records/documents that relate to policies/procedures/manuals (such as training manual(s)) for which Medical Review Officers (MROs) outline guidelines with which MROs adhere to per F.S. 112.0455.

3. Records/documents that relate to employer abuse of F.S. 112.0455, including but not limited to making false or fictitious statements to Florida Department of Regulations Workers’ Compensation Division, and the consequences of an employer abusing the aforementioned Florida Statute.

4.Records/documents that relate to employer consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions when intentionally abusing or defrauding the Florida Department of Financial Services per F.S. 112.0455  (as an example, by trick or deceit, lack of reasonable suspicion, making materially false or fictitious statements).

5. Records/documents relating to if/when/how the fourth amendment applies as it relates to private employers (ie, nongovernmental employers) subjecting employees to reasonable suspicion drug testing and if such cases are known to Florida Department of Financial Services.

6. Records/documents relating to a private employer in which such employer could be considered a state actor, acting on behalf of the government, or under the direction of the government within the context of reasonable suspicion testing.

7. Records/documents relating to if or in what manner an employer’s policies can extend beyond the scope of the F.S. 112.0455 and the Florida Department of Financial Services’ guidelines (if such records exist).

8. Records relating to persons who can formally assess an employee within a hospital setting under the pretense of reasonable suspicion testing. Additionally, the qualifications, credentials, licensure, or training that such persons must have.

9. The scope and extent to which the Agency for Healthcare Administers applies to F.S. 112.0455 as ACHA is expressly stated throughout such Florida Statue, it is known or can be clearly elucidated.

10. What sections of F.S. 112.0455, if any, an employer need or must adhere to if a private employer voluntarily chooses not to comply with the stated Florida Statue.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending on the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Scope per F.S. 114.0455
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

To clarify: This relates to specifically the Division of Workers’ Compensation as it is known to be the specific division that enforces and oversees the aforementioned F.S.

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

communications.communication:
Dear e e: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Idaho State Police. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Idaho Public Records Law. Your request was received in this office on 1/9/2024 and given the reference number R030058-010924 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents that were active between 1/1/2018 and 1/9/2024 with Forensic Logic or SoundThinking for the use of CopLink or CrimeTracer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fidaho-state-police-814%252Fpublic-records-request-coplink-156792%252F%253Femail%253Didahosp%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABaWjPCu6Xs4oBtWpf6h44rMEA%3A1rNNky%3AYJxHi39soycGpY2bzcVtokiR_feNRH43gg8m99aY2i4 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Idaho Public Records Law does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Idaho State Police

title: Public Information Request: Homeland Security Grants

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: Homeland Security Grants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Abbott's office on November 7, 2023, the Public Safety Office is administering 383 grant awards totaling $62 million for "homeland security" associated programs: https://gov.texas.gov/news/post/governor-abbott-announces-over-528-million-in-public-safety-grants

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents sufficient to show the full list of awardees and amounts for the 383 awards totaling $62 million for "homeland security" associated programs described in Gov. Abbott's press release, linked above, from November 7, 2023. 

This request is not seeking further documentation beyond the list of awardees and amount awarded to each.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

title: Police Report & Files - Cantrell Funeral Home (Michigan State Police)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Police Report & Files - Cantrell Funeral Home (Michigan State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the investigative file related to Cantrell Funeral Home located at 10400 Mack Avenue, Detroit, Wayne County, specifically related to the October 2018 discovery of multiple sets of human remains within the home. Inspections of the funeral home were conducted on August 29 and October 12, 2018. Please include the responding officers' reports and interview recordings/transcripts, if available. Photographs and body camera footage do not need to be included.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Caitlin Downey

title: MA Dept. of Corrections Investigation - Interviews and Testimony

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: MA Dept. of Corrections Investigation - Interviews and Testimony
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Transcripts and/or audio files of interviews, testimony and exit conferences created during the Department of Justice investigation into the Massachusetts Department of Corrections. According to the investigation report published by this office on November 17, 2020, these interviews were primarily conducted between April and November in 2019. Additionally, I am requesting any notes and memos created during site visits conducted during the same time period.

Please note I am making this request in the public interest and am not seeking any identifiable personal information of interview subjects. If any such information is present in responsive documents, I am open and amendable to appropriate redactions as long as the corresponding FOIA exemption(s) are cited. If any aspect of the search for these records is unduly burdensome or unclear, please notify me and I will be happy to clarify or amend the scope of my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adrien Salzberg

title: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we respectfully request all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. Specifically, we seek emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/brazilian-man-ice-custody-passes-away-new-mexico-hospital?s=09
and here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/nicaraguan-man-ice-custody-passes-away-colorado-hospital

By definition, the information requested cannot be subject to withholding under Exemption 7A (open investigations), because ICE has already released its core facts publicly.

We seek expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 in support thereof: 
1. Both the Torrance in-custody death and the Aurora in-custody death have been met with calls from elected Representatives and Senators for vigorous investigation, based on each facility's documented track record. See https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/heinrich-leads-request-for-immediate-action-from-ice-to-address-inhumane-unsafe-conditions-for-migrants-at-the-torrance-county-detention-facility and https://crow.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/crow.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/2022.10.21-final-icedhs-letter_0.pdf. 

2. Both deaths have been the subject of widespread and sustained media attention. 
For Torrance: 
https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/22/us/politics/aclu-ice-immigration-detention.html
https://sourcenm.com/2022/09/01/brazilian-asylum-seeker-who-died-by-suicide-held-in-horrific-conditions-attorneys-say/
https://nmpoliticalreport.com/2022/08/31/immigrant-advocacy-organizations-seeking-answers-around-brazilian-mans-death-by-suicide-while-in-ice-custody/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/10/18/headlines/asylum_seekers_at_torrance_ice_jail_claim_retaliation_over_hunger_strike
https://theappeal.org/torrance-detention-center-kesley-vial-brazil/
https://www.santafenewmexican.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/close-torrance-county-ice-facility-now/article_08a7cf58-5705-11ed-b432-1bb650ab5a32.html
https://www.krqe.com/news/crime/man-commits-suicide-in-ice-custody-in-torrance-county/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/8/29/headlines/asylum_seeker_dies_by_suicide_at_for_profit_ice_jail_in_new_mexico
https://www.abqjournal.com/2528527/webhedline-126.html
https://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/local/new-mexico/2022/09/30/groups-retaliation-after-migrants-report-torrance-county-detention-center/69530415007/

For Aurora: 
https://www.cpr.org/2022/10/27/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-investigation-into-death-at-aurora-ice-facility/
https://www.cpr.org/2022/11/03/advocates-immigration-customs-enforcement-custody-death/
https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/man-nicaragua-dies-aurora-ice-facility/73-f52d0d45-531c-4e17-a361-1376d887e499
https://www.denver7.com/news/local-news/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-probe-after-detainees-death-at-aurora-ice-facility
https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/melvin-ariel-calero-mendoza-nicaraguan-father-dies-ice-custody-aurora-facility/
https://www.longmontleader.com/local-news/el-comite-wants-answers-to-ice-detention-death-5990654
https://news.yahoo.com/video/nicaraguan-father-two-dies-ice-040542382.html
https://www.newsbreak.com/news/2810691040469/report-details-what-led-up-to-man-s-death-in-aurora-ice-custody

3. In both cases, serious questions have been raised by elected officials as to the circumstances surrounding each person's death, and ICE and its contractors' compliance with mandatory duties surrounding care of detained immigrants. 

Therefore, the requirements of 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) are satisfied, and expedited processing is proper. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important request, and your response within the statutorily required 10-calendar day period! 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
12/21/2022Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 11/8/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. .  Your request was received in this office on 11/8/2022.After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is 1) too broad in scope, 2) did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking, or 3) only posed questions to the agency.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.  Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Marcus Francis at (866) 633-1182 or the address above.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03462. Sincerely,ICE-FOIA 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about
 to learn more. 
v.E.1

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s determination that the request is improper. 

It seeks:

“emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted [on ICE’s website].”

We seek expedited processing of this request for the reasons described in our original submission. 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

01/10/2023Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICAP-00243Dear Requester:The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 12/23/2022, was received on 1/5/2023.The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2023-ICAP-00243 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal.A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter. communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #2023-ICAP-00243.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).

SecureRelease website support staff are not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-ICAP-00243 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal, therefore, we are unable to provide online status tracking or portal messaging capabilities for this request.

We have CC’ed the ICE FOIA inbox for visibility. To follow up further on this request, please refer to communications you received from the agency for contact instructions or reach out to the agency in the same manner that you submitted your request.

Regards,

SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good day,

In regards to 2023-ICAP+00243, we have queried the appropriate component of DHS for responsive records.  If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability.  We will process your request as expeditiously as possible.  Upon completion of the processing, all documents that can be released will be made available to you as soon as possible.

Thank you,
ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You are legally required to provide an estimated date on which documents will be produced.

You are legally required to make a determination on this request and inform us of it. 

You are legally required to make records promptly available. 

You have failed to comply with any of these requirements. 

If you have any intention of doing so within the next fourteen days, please inform us. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 

Your assertion that “a high number of FOIA requests have been received by the Department” is unsupported by the Department’s own FY22 Chief FOIA Officer Report. In other words, you’re saying a thing that your own data demonstrate is untrue. 

But go off, I guess. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913
communications.communication:
12/12/2023 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 11/22/2023, was received on 12/11/2023. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2024-ICAP-00071 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Fernando Pineiro Jr., ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Acting Chief 
Government Information Law Division 
ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

communications.communication:
The New York City Police Department (NYPD) has closed your FOIL request FOIL-2023-056-31017 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2023-056-31017) 
 The requested documents were previously sent to you via email. Redactions have been made to the document(s) in that release of information would represent an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy {§ 87.2 (b)}. Your request under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) has been reviewed and the documents you requested have been posted on the OpenRecords portal. 
You may appeal the decision to deny access to material that was redacted in part or withheld in entirety by contacting the agency's FOIL Appeals Officer: foilappeals@nypd.org within 30 days. (mailto:foilappeals@nypd.org?subject=FOIL-2023-056-31017%20-%20Appeal)

title: Marysville Pilchuck Shooting Incident Report

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Marysville Pilchuck Shooting Incident Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Marysville Pilchuck High School on October 24, 2014.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Baker

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of 9/4/2023, Reference #D005184-090423 
Dear Ben Baker, 
The City received a public records request from you on 9/4/2023. You requested the following: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Marysville Pilchuck High School on October 24, 2014. 

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ben Baker" 
This letter is to inform you of the estimated cost to complete your request from the Everett Police Department. 
You have asked to be notified if there would be any fees.  The full report is 2,231 pages that require scanning.  Per our stated fees, EPD charges 0.10 per page for scanning.  Everett PD estimates that the full report will be $223.10.  As this is an estimate, EPD will charge for each installment when it is released and once payment for each installment is made, then we will complete the next installment and so on until the request is completed. 
Please let me know how you would like to proceed. 
You may provide a response to the Everett Police Department by any of the following methods: 
1. by replying to this electronic mail 
2. by replying via the Everett Public Records Portal 
3. by regular mail to the Everett Police Records Unit at 3002 Wetmore Ave, Everett, WA 98201 
4. in person at the Everett Police Records Unit at 3002 Wetmore Ave, Everett, WA 98201 
Upon receipt of your answer regarding fees, the Everett Police Department will further respond to your request as required by law, including providing you with an estimate of costs associated with producing the requested records. 
If you have any questions, please contact our office at epddisclosure@everettwa.gov Thank you for your attention. (mailto:epddisclosure@everettwa.gov) 
Sincerely, 
Brent Flagg 
Everett Police Department 
Public Disclosure Manager 
425-257-8471
